actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide a penalty for persons who interfere with the conduct of judicial proceedings, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Prescribes a penalty of up to a $5,000 fine or imprisonment for up to five years, or both, for persons who willfully and repeatedly interfere with the conduct of judicial proceedings with noisy outbursts, obscenities, or insults. (Adds 18 U.S.C. 1511)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide a penalty for persons who interfere with the conduct of judicial proceedings, and for other purposes.
